boat.name: Jay Jay
boat.full_description: JayJay is a Cape Henry 21 designed by Dudley Dix. She is a gaff cutter made of plywood and epoxy. She has a new Mariner 6hp outboard in a well and is easily trailed with her 4 wheel trailer. She sails beautifully and has been very competitive in Old Gaffers races. She was the subject of a video by Bob Aylott of Yachting World 3 years ago which has been viewed 1/4 million times ! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VzIz4vhsF7Y .
boat.short_description: Completed in 2013, JayJay is a gaff rigged cutter of plywood and epoxy construction.

for_sales.sales_text: The Cape Henry 21 is a gaff cutter designed by Dudley Dix, JayJay was completed in 2013, and is built of marine ply (Robbins Elite, Lloyds approved), West Epoxy and mahogany with teak deck strips. She has 3/4 adult berths below with double spirit stove, plumbed in sink, porta-potti and lots of storage. She is fitted with electrics, chart plotter, VHF, depth sounder, nav lights and a solar panel.  She is in very good condition and comes with a brand-new Mariner 6 hp engine and 4-wheel road trailer which is regularly serviced. JayJay has a galvanised steel centreplate and hollow douglas fir mast. She has completed in both the Round the Island Race and Yarmouth Gaffers, coming second in her size category. Her build featured in Practical Boat Owner (Jan 2014) and in a video by Yachting Monthly’s Bob Aylott – search on “My Classic Boat Cape Henry 21”. Moored at Bucklers Hard normally, she is currently at my home in Essex for her normal winter maintenance. She comes with complete builder’s plans.
